gui.BuddyMessageClient.BuddyMessageClient¶

class gui.BuddyMessageClient.BuddyMessageClient(server_ip, port_num, frame=None, str_format='utf-8')¶

Bases: object

A TCP client which sends messages in text form. Each message sent connects, sends, then disconnects.

Parameters

  • server_ip (String) – the ip address of the server

  • port_num (int) – the port number of the server

  • frame (Tkinter frame, optional) – the frame on which error messages will be displayed. Defaults to None

  • str_format (String) – the encoding format in which messages are sent

__init__(server_ip, port_num, frame=None, str_format='utf-8')¶

Constructor for BuddyMessageClient

Methods

__init__(server_ip, port_num[, frame, …])

Constructor for BuddyMessageClient

connect([text])

Connects to the server.

disconnect()

Disconnects from the server if connected, otherwise does nothing

handleSend(msg_str)

Connects to the server, sends a message, then disconnects

sendMsg(msg_str)

Starts handleSend in a new thread which sends a message to the server

setPortNum(new_port)

Sets the port number

show_error(error_msg)

Displays the error message on the frame
connect(text='DEFAULT_MESSAGE')¶

Connects to the server. Displays error if unsuccessful

Parameters

text (String) – unused

Returns

true if connection is successful, false if there is a connection error, and None if undefined error occurrs

Return type

boolean

disconnect()¶

Disconnects from the server if connected, otherwise does nothing

handleSend(msg_str)¶

Connects to the server, sends a message, then disconnects

Parameters

msg_str (String) – the message to send to the server

sendMsg(msg_str)¶

Starts handleSend in a new thread which sends a message to the server

Parameters

msg_str (String) – the message to send to the server

setPortNum(new_port)¶

Sets the port number

Parameters

new_port (int) – the value of the new port number

show_error(error_msg)¶

Displays the error message on the frame

Parameters

error_msg (String) – the content of the error message
